function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Possible spread of the coronavirus through wastewater","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of attention to environmental aspects of personal protective equipment disposal","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to clean drinkable water","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality leading to respiratory issues","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of water and wastewater with the virus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased promotion of antimicrobial additions in building products","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative psychological effects of quarantine on mental health","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased greenery in urban environments","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in housing layout and design leading to potential lack of privacy and overcrowding","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Selection of indoor finishing materials impacting virus lifetimes on surfaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission risk through contact with surfaces in bathrooms and public restrooms","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Health risks associated with toxic antimicrobial additives in indoor finishing materials","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strain on health systems during unexpected situations like pandemics","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to visit hospitals or healthcare facilities due to lockdowns","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited involvement of architects and urban planners in response to pandemics","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited focus on the social pillar in sustainability assessment rating systems","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unequal priority given to key sustainability categories in rating systems","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of supply chains and logistical challenges during quarantine","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited internet access for households in the commonwealth of independent states cis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic fallout leading to increased poverty and malnutrition in central asian countries","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in hospital and community wastewater collection sites","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor waste management of home quarantine waste","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Suspension of recycling practices during a pandemic","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased water consumption and lack of sustainable water use during pandemics","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased household energy consumption due to remote work and lockdowns","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased medical waste from single-use masks and gloves","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to private outdoor space for people suffering from lung diseases, leading to potential health decline.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased consumption of resources in homes during extended lockdowns, leading to environmental impacts and resource health.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited capacity to prevent virus transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased including mental health.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unavailability of icts leading to deficient use of necessary services, such as medical consultation and food/medicines delivery.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sudden drop in economic activity during lockdowns making it difficult for several population classes to pay for increasing risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Isolation of residential complexes due to infected inhabitants, leading to the spread of infections among occupants.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of increased energy usage and the need for sustainable energy sources due to global lockdowns.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of viral transmission in densely populated buildings due to lack of ventilation and proximity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sanitation and hygiene measures leading to contamination and disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High planning for emergency facility requirements and medical infrastructure may result in insufficient response to future outbreaks.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation in the built environment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"}]}
